alert.note: Alert for Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 03 at 10:02PM MDT until April 04 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning will be in effect from the late morning to the evening on Tuesday... ..An approaching upper level storm system will continue to bring strong winds to the region through Tuesday. Expect strong west winds of 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 50 to 60 mph through the day on Tuesday. These strong winds, in combination with min RH`s between 5 to 15% will induce critical fire weather conditions. The strong winds will continue into the early evening hours before dropping off a little after sunset. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 055, 056, 110, 111, 112, AND 113... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 110, 111, 112, 113 in New Mexico. Fire weather zones 055 and 056 in Far West Texas. * WIND...West winds of 20 to 35 mph with gusts near 50 to 60 mph. * HUMIDITY...5 to 15% * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
